table-wrap.anchoringText: The pressure responses for Well A in 2006 and 2008 are shown in Fig. 4, which behave as composite model reservoir. The matching and interpretation results are given in Fig. 4 and Table 1. If the mobility ratio of water region is equal to the reservoir oil or the inner radius is relatively small, the pressure behavior may behave as homogenous reservoir. However, the mobility of water injected always has a significant difference with reservoir oil, which reflects in two aspects:
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Well testing interpretation results for Well A in 2006 and 2008

formatted-caption.caption-text: Well testing interpretation results for Well A in 2006 and 2008

table-wrap.anchoringText: There is growing evidence, including step rate test, production history of water injector and producer, well testing analysis, inter-connectivity analysis, indicate the initiation of WIF in water injection process (Wang et al. 2017a). The fundamental differences between propped hydraulic fractures in producer and WIFs in water injector are summed up in Table 2.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: Comparison of propped hydraulic fractures in producer and WIFs in water injector (Modified from Yawar Rizwan 2017 )

formatted-caption.caption-text: Comparison of propped hydraulic fractures in producer and WIFs in water injector (Modified from Yawar Rizwan 2017 )

linkTarget.bib:
Rizwan, 2017
Yawar Rizwan . 2017. Pressure Transient Analysis for Minifracs/DFIT and Waterflood Induced Fractures . Master thesis, Technical Univerisity of Delft, The Netherlands.

table-wrap.anchoringText: Different with propped (static) hydraulic fracture in production wells, the WIF would close gradually as the decrease of BHP after shutting in the well. As a result, the fracture conductivity is decreasing during the fracture closing process, which has a big influence on pressure response. Using the model we proposed (Wang et al. 2017b), we interpreted the Well D, shown in Fig. 8. The results are given in Table 3.
table-wrap.label: Table 3
table-wrap.caption: Well testing interpretation results for Well D

formatted-caption.caption-text: Well testing interpretation results for Well D
